TECHNIQUE.name: File content
TECHNIQUE.DESCRIPTION:
Checks if a file matches a given content and if not, updates it.
This technique can edit file lines, file sections, remove or add content, and change file permissions.

INPUT.NAME: GENERIC_FILE_CONTENT_PATH
INPUT.DESCRIPTION: Full path of the file to manage
INPUT.LONGDESCRIPTION: This is the full path of the file on the agent

INPUT.NAME: GENERIC_FILE_CONTENT_CREATE_BOOLEAN
INPUT.DESCRIPTION: Create the file if it doesn't exist

INPUT.NAME: GENERIC_FILE_CONTENT_ENFORCE_CREATE_ONLY_BOOLEAN
INPUT.LONGDESCRIPTION: If true, the file will be created if it doesn't exist, and only then. If the file already exists, it will be left untouched.

INPUT.NAME: GENERIC_FILE_CONTENT_ENFORCE
INPUT.LONGDESCRIPTION: If true, the file will exactly contain what is in the "Content of the file" field, otherwise the content will be added, leaving the rest of the file untouched

INPUT.NAME: GENERIC_FILE_CONTENT_SECTION_MANAGEMENT
INPUT.DESCRIPTION: Enable file content in a section
INPUT.LONGDESCRIPTION: Match a portion of the file between two lines (header/footer) and enforce the content between those lines. If they don't exist, the whole section will be added at the end of the file.

INPUT.NAME: GENERIC_FILE_SECTION_HEADER
INPUT.LONGDESCRIPTION: First line of the section to enforce content in. If not found, this line and the section content will be added at the end of the file. If left empty, no sections will be edited.

INPUT.NAME: GENERIC_FILE_SECTION_CONTENT
INPUT.LONGDESCRIPTION: The exact content of the section (without the header and footer).

INPUT.NAME: GENERIC_FILE_SECTION_FOOTER
INPUT.LONGDESCRIPTION: Last line of the section to enforce content in. If not found, this line and the section content will be added at the end of the file. If left empty, no sections will be edited.

INPUT.NAME: GENERIC_FILE_CONTENT_DELETION_REGEXP
INPUT.LONGDESCRIPTION: Regular expression used to match a line to be deleted

INPUT.NAME: GENERIC_FILE_CONTENT_MODIFICATION_REGEXP
INPUT.LONGDESCRIPTION: Regular expression used to match a line to be replaced. This regular expression must not match the string used as a replacement. For example, to set kernel.shmmax = 5678, the Regular expression would be kernel.shmmax = (?!5678$).* and the string used as remplacement remplacement kernel.shmmax = 5678

INPUT.NAME: GENERIC_FILE_CONTENT_ONLY_ZONE_BOOLEAN
INPUT.DESCRIPTION: Limit all file modifications to a zone
INPUT.LONGDESCRIPTION: If yes, all modifications above file will be only in the zone described in section "Modify content only in zone", except for "Enforce content by section". If you select also "Migrate lines to the zone", every line added in this zone will be removed from the rest of the file (and section moved to this zone), otherwise the rest of the file remains untouched

INPUT.NAME: GENERIC_FILE_CONTENT_ZONE_HEADER
INPUT.LONGDESCRIPTION: If not found, this line and the section content will be added at the end of the file.

CONSTRAINT.DEFAULT: ### Beginning of section managed by Rudder

INPUT.NAME: GENERIC_FILE_CONTENT_ZONE_FOOTER
INPUT.LONGDESCRIPTION: If not found, this line and the section content will be added at the end of the file. If left empty, end of file will be assumed

CONSTRAINT.DEFAULT: ### End of section managed by Rudder

INPUT.NAME: GENERIC_FILE_CONTENT_MIGRATE_TO_ZONE_BOOLEAN
INPUT.LONGDESCRIPTION: If yes, all lines defined in "Content of the file" field and "Enforce content by section" section will be added in the zone, and removed from the rest of the file, otherwise only the zone will be edited, leaving the rest of the file untouched (and allowing the possibility of duplicated lines). The lines modifications and lines deletion will still apply only in the zone if zone modification is defined.

INPUT.NAME: GENERIC_FILE_CONTENT_PERMISSION_ADJUSTMENT
INPUT.LONGDESCRIPTION: If false, file permissions won't be touched

INPUT.NAME: GENERIC_FILE_CONTENT_POST_HOOK_RUN
INPUT.LONGDESCRIPTION: Should the command(s) below be run if any modifications are made on the path above?

INPUT.NAME: GENERIC_FILE_CONTENT_POST_HOOK_COMMAND
INPUT.LONGDESCRIPTION: List of shell-compatible statements to be executed. Multiple commands may be specified on separate lines.
